contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{otherships|USS Chippewa}} {|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[Image:USS Chippewa (1861).jpg|300px|USS Chippewa under construction]] |Ship caption=USS ''Chippewa'' under construction }} {{Infobox Ship Career |Hide header= |Ship country=US |Ship flag={{USN flag|1865}} |Ship name=USS ''Chippewa'' |Ship namesake= |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=[[Webb and Bell]] |Ship laid down= |Ship launched=14 September 1861 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned=13 December 1861 |Ship decommissioned=24 June 1865 |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship honours= |Ship fate=Sold, 30 November 1865 |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics | Hide header= | Header caption= | Ship class= {{sclass|Unadilla|gunboat|3}} | Ship type= | Ship tonnage= | Ship displacement= 691 tons | Ship tons burthen= 507 | Ship length= {{convert|158|ft|m|abbr=on}} ([[waterline]]) | Ship beam= {{convert|28|ft|m|abbr=on}} | Ship draft= {{convert|9|ft|6|in|m|abbr=on}} (max.) | Ship hold depth= {{convert|12|ft|m|abbr=on}} | Ship decks= | Ship deck clearance= | Ship ramps= | Ship ice class= | Ship power= | Ship propulsion= 2 × 200 [[indicated horsepower|IHP]] 30-in [[bore (engine)|bore]] by 18 in [[stroke (engine)|stroke]] horizontal [[marine steam engine#Back acting|back-acting]] engines; single screw | Ship sail plan= Two-masted [[schooner]] | Ship speed= {{convert|10|kn|mph|sigfig=3|abbr=on}} | Ship complement= 114 | Ship armament= Original: <br/> 1 × 11-in [[Dahlgren gun|Dahlgren]] [[smoothbore]] <br/> 2 × 24-pdr smoothbore <br/> 2 × 20-pdr [[Parrott rifle]] | Ship notes= }} |} The third '''USS ''Chippewa''''' was a {{sclass|Unadilla|gunboat|3}} which saw service with the [[U.S. Navy]] during the [[American Civil War]]. One of the "[[Ninety-day gunboat]]s", ''Chippewa'' was launched 14 September 1861 by [[Webb and Bell]], New York; outfitted at [[New York Navy Yard]]; and commissioned 13 December 1861, Lieutenant [[Andrew Bryson]] in command. Sailing from New York 25 December 1861 ''Chippewa'' took station on the blockade between [[Fort Monroe, Virginia]], and [[Hatteras Inlet, North Carolina]], remaining there until 9 August 1862 except for a brief repair period at [[Baltimore, Maryland]] 8 March–13 March. During this time she exchanged fire with the enemy at [[Fort Macon|Forts Macon]] and [[Fort Caswell|Caswell]] and [[Federal Point Batteries]], and assisted in the capture of a blockade runner, the [[England|English]] [[brig]] [[HMS Napier|''Napier'']] 29 July 1862. ''Chippewa'' arrived at the [[Washington Navy Yard]], 10 August 1862. Returning to Fort Monroe she departed from there 18 October 1862 on a cruise in search of [[CSS Florida|CSS ''Florida'']] which took her to the [[Azores]]; [[Algeciras]] and [[Cadiz]], Spain; [[Gibraltar]]; [[Funchal, Madeira]]; [[Porto Grande]], [[Africa]]; [[Cape Verde Islands]]; and various ports in the [[West Indies]]. Returning to [[Port Royal, South Carolina]], 30 May 1863, she resumed patrols with the [[South Atlantic Blockading Squadron]] off the coast of [[South Carolina]] and [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]]. She participated in the attacks on [[Fort Wagner, South Carolina]], from 13 July to 21 July 1863, and opened fire on enemy pickets up [[Broad River (South Carolina)|Broad River]], on 12 November. After repairs at [[Philadelphia Navy Yard]], she returned to [[North Carolina]] to take part in the bombardments and capture of [[Fort Fisher]] in December 1864 and January 1865 and [[Fort Anderson]], [[Cape Fear River]], North Carolina, in February 1865. ''Chippewa'' departed [[Wilmington, North Carolina]], 1 March 1865 and steamed up the [[James River (Virginia)|James River]] for patrol duty until 15 May, engaging enemy batteries at [[Dutch Gap Canal]] on 1 April and 2 April. After cruising to [[Havana, Cuba]], between 17 May and 12 June 1865, ''Chippewa'' arrived at [[Boston, Massachusetts|Boston]] 17 June where she was decommissioned 24 June 1865, taken to New York 29 June and sold there 30 November 1865. ==References== {{Commons|USS Chippewa (1861)}} {{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/c8/chippewa-iii.htm}} {{Unadilla class gunboat}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chippewa}} [[Category:Ships of the Union Navy]] [[Category:Ships built in New York]] [[Category:American Civil War patrol vessels of the United States]] [[Category:1861 ships]] [[Category:Unadilla-class gunboats]]
